args.reason: Neither a 'More Actions' button nor a status change dropdown is present or visible on the page after loading; grounding issue.

assertor_results.query: Wait until the page finishes loading and either 'More Actions' button or status change dropdown becomes visible on the invoice edit page.

synthesis.page_description: The page is the 'Edit Invoice' screen of an invoicing web application (Invoice Ninja). The left sidebar contains navigation links for various modules such as Dashboard, Clients, Products, Invoices (highlighted), Recurring Invoices, Payments, Quotes, Credits, Projects, Tasks, Vendors, Purchase Orders, Expenses, Recurring Expenses, Transactions, and Reports. The main content area shows a breadcrumb navigation ('Invoices > Edit Invoice'), and several tabs: Edit (selected), Documents, Settings, Activity, History, Email History. The 'Edit' tab displays invoice details: Status (Draft), company name placeholder with client edit/view options; contact information; invoice date fields; invoice number; PO number; discount field with a dropdown arrow. Below this are tabs for Products and Tasks. A product line item is visible with fields for item name ('product_n'), description ('product_description'), unit cost (60,000), quantity (1), and line total ($60,000.00). At the top right are buttons: 'Purchase White Label', 'Save', and a blue dropdown arrow next to Save.

assertion_checking.observation: To validate the assertion that the page has finished loading and either the 'More Actions' button or status change dropdown is visible on the invoice edit page: I would expect to see either a button labeled 'More Actions' or a dropdown control related to changing status somewhere on the interface.
assertion_checking.verification: In the screenshot provided there is no explicit button labeled 'More Actions'. However, there is a blue dropdown arrow immediately adjacent to the 'Save' button in the top right corner of the page. This commonly indicates additional actions are available via a dropdown menu—functionally equivalent to a 'More Actions' menu in many web applications. There is also a clear status indicator ('Draft') shown in the main panel but no separate status change dropdown visible within this viewport.

verdict.discrepancies: The label does not explicitly say 'More Actions', but based on standard UI conventions in business applications like this one—and its placement next to primary action buttons—the blue dropdown arrow next to Save likely serves as an actions menu trigger. No other discrepancies noted.

assertor_results.query: Wait for the invoice edit page to finish loading and check if either a 'More Actions' button or a status change dropdown becomes visible in the main content area.

synthesis.page_description: The page is the 'Edit Invoice' screen of an invoicing web application (Invoice Ninja). The layout includes a left sidebar with navigation options such as Dashboard, Clients, Products, Invoices (highlighted), and more. The main content area displays invoice details: status ('Draft'), client information, contact email, invoice date (27/08/2025), due date field, partial/deposit field, invoice number (#123456), PO number field, and discount dropdown. Tabs for Edit/Documents/Settings/Activity/History/Email History are present. Below these fields is a products table showing item details (item name, description, unit cost, quantity, line total). At the top right are 'Purchase White Label' and 'Save' buttons; the Save button has a dropdown arrow indicating additional actions.

assertion_checking.observation: I would expect to see either a clearly labeled 'More Actions' button or a status change dropdown somewhere in the main content area of the page after it has finished loading.
assertion_checking.verification: In the screenshot provided, there is no visible button explicitly labeled 'More Actions'. However, next to the blue 'Save' button at the top right of the main content area there is a downward-facing arrow indicating that this may be a dropdown menu containing additional actions. There is also no obvious status change dropdown in view; only a static status indicator ('Draft') appears.

verdict.discrepancies: There is no explicit 'More Actions' label visible; however, the presence of a dropdown arrow next to 'Save' strongly suggests that additional actions are accessible from this control. No separate status change dropdown is seen.

assertor_results.query: Wait until the loading spinner disappears and verify that the main expense edit page content is fully loaded and visible.

synthesis.page_description:
The page displayed is the 'Edit Expense' screen of an expense management application (Invoice Ninja). The layout includes a left sidebar with navigation options such as Dashboard, Clients, Products, Invoices, Recurring Invoices, Payments, Quotes, Credits, Projects, Tasks, Vendors, Purchase Orders, Expenses (highlighted), Recurring Expenses, Transactions, and Reports. The main content area shows breadcrumb navigation ('Expenses > Edit Expense'), a header with the page title ('Edit Expense'), and action buttons at the top right ('Purchase White Label', 'Save', and a dropdown arrow). Below this are two tabs: 'Edit' (selected) and 'Documents'. The main form is divided into three columns: 
- Left: Expense Total ($23,234.00), Details section (Status: Logged; Expense Number: 0001; Vendor dropdown; Client field with company_name selected; Project dropdown).
- Center: Notes section (Public Notes and Private Notes text areas).
- Right: Additional Info section with toggles for 'Should be invoiced', 'Mark Paid', and 'Convert currency'.
No loading spinner or overlay is visible anywhere on the page. All interactive elements appear enabled.

assertion_checking.observation:
To validate the assertion that the loading spinner has disappeared and the main expense edit page content is fully loaded and visible:
- There should be no loading spinner or overlay present.
- All primary sections of the edit expense page should be visible (form fields for details/notes/additional info).
- Interactive elements should not appear disabled or obscured.
assertion_checking.verification: There is no loading spinner or overlay present in any part of the screenshot. The entire edit expense form—including all fields in Details/Notes/Additional Info—is clearly visible. Navigation elements are accessible. No part of the UI appears to be disabled or blocked by a loader.

assertor_results.query: Wait until the credit edit form and line items table are fully loaded and visible on the page.

synthesis.page_description: The page is titled 'Edit Credit' in the Invoice Ninja application. The left sidebar contains navigation options such as Dashboard, Clients, Products, Invoices, Recurring Invoices, Payments, Quotes, Credits (highlighted), Projects, Tasks, Vendors, Purchase Orders, Expenses, Recurring Expenses, Transactions, and Reports. The main content area displays breadcrumb navigation ('Credits > Edit Credit'), and a tabbed interface with tabs for Edit (selected), Documents, Settings, Activity, and History. Under the 'Edit' tab are two main panels: one showing credit status (Draft), client information (company_name), contact details (first_name last_name with email), and another panel for credit details including Credit Date (27/08/2025), Credit Number (123456), PO # field (empty), Discount field (dropdown). Below these panels is a table labeled with columns ITEM, DESCRIPTION, UNIT COST, QUANTITY (with value 1 for the first line item), and LINE TOTAL ($60,000.00). The first line item fields are visible and editable.

assertion_checking.observation: The credit edit form should be fully loaded with all relevant fields visible. The line items table should be present on the page with at least one row displayed.
assertion_checking.verification: The screenshot shows the full credit edit form loaded with all expected fields visible: status panel on the left; credit date/number/etc on the right; below that is a clearly rendered line items table containing at least one row where ITEM ('product_n'), DESCRIPTION ('product_description'), UNIT COST ('60,000'), QUANTITY ('1'), and LINE TOTAL ('$60,000.00') are all present.

assertor_results.query: Verify that the page has finished loading and interactive elements, including the 'More Actions' dropdown button, are visible.

synthesis.page_description: The page is the 'Edit Credit' screen of the Invoice Ninja web application. The left sidebar contains navigation links for various modules such as Dashboard, Clients, Products, Invoices, Recurring Invoices, Payments, Quotes, Credits (highlighted), Projects, Tasks, Vendors, Purchase Orders, Expenses, Recurring Expenses, Transactions, and Reports. At the top of the main content area are breadcrumb links ('Credits > Edit Credit'), a set of tabs (Edit - selected by default; Documents; Settings; Activity; History), and a gear icon for settings. Below this is a form displaying credit details: status ('Draft'), client information with contact details and portal link options on the left; credit date (27/08/2025), valid until field (empty), partial/deposit field (empty) in the center; credit number ('123456'), PO # (empty), and discount fields on the right. Below these sections is an itemized table with columns for Item, Description, Unit Cost ($60,000.00), Quantity (1), and Line Total ($60,000.00). At the top right are buttons for 'Purchase White Label', 'Save', and a dropdown arrow next to Save.

assertion_checking.observation: To validate this assertion I would expect to see that the page has fully loaded without any loading spinners or overlays obscuring content. Interactive elements such as buttons or dropdowns should be visible—specifically including the 'More Actions' dropdown button.
assertion_checking.verification: The screenshot shows that all main content areas are fully rendered with no loading indicators present. The interface appears interactive: navigation links in the sidebar are visible and clickable-looking; form fields can be seen clearly filled or ready for input/editing; action buttons like 'Save' and its adjacent dropdown arrow are present at top right. However, there is no explicit button labeled 'More Actions' visible in this viewport—the only dropdown-style button shown is next to 'Save'.

verdict.discrepancies: The expected 'More Actions' dropdown button is not explicitly visible anywhere in this screenshot. While other interactive elements are present and page load appears complete with no overlays or spinners obstructing interaction, absence of a clearly labeled or identifiable 'More Actions' button means this assertion cannot be fully verified as passed.

assertor_results.query: Wait until the page finishes loading and all main UI elements, including buttons and menus, are visible.

synthesis.page_description: The page is the 'Edit Credit' screen of the Invoice Ninja web application. The left sidebar contains navigation links for Dashboard, Clients, Products, Invoices, Recurring Invoices, Payments, Quotes, Credits (highlighted), Projects, Tasks, Vendors, Purchase Orders, Expenses, Recurring Expenses, Transactions, and Reports. At the top right are buttons for 'Purchase White Label', 'Save', and a dropdown arrow next to Save. The main content area displays breadcrumb navigation ('Credits > Edit Credit'), and tabs for Edit (selected), Documents, Settings, Activity, and History. The Edit tab shows credit details: Status (Draft), company name with client links and contact info; fields for Credit Date (27/08/2025), Valid Until (empty), Partial/Deposit (empty), Credit Number (123456), PO # (empty), Discount. Below is an itemized table with columns ITEM (product_n), DESCRIPTION (product_description), UNIT COST ($60,000.00), QUANTITY (1) and LINE TOTAL ($60,000.00). All UI elements appear loaded and visible.

assertion_checking.observation: I would expect to see that the page has finished loading with all main UI elements such as navigation menus on the left sidebar; header buttons including Save; tabs like Edit/Documents/Settings/etc.; form fields for credit details; itemized product table; and no loading spinners or overlays obscuring content.
assertion_checking.verification: The screenshot shows all expected UI elements fully rendered: sidebar menu is present with Credits highlighted; header contains action buttons; breadcrumb navigation is visible; all tabs are shown at the top of the main panel; form fields are filled or ready for input without any missing components or overlays. There are no signs of loading indicators or incomplete rendering.
